subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Electrical Question
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0042_01C9DEA1.4BE94710
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

It is an attached, single family home,. The complex was built in the 70's, =
so I am sure the wiring is old. I do not know if it is aluminum though.

Yo=
u make a good point, that tapping could be coming form something not direct=
ly related to the wiring, but tapping because of the surges it receives.

 =
 ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Frank Sumption 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoog=
roups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, May 27, 2009 7:16 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC]=
 Electrical Question






   We have a touch lamp that comes on by itself,=
 and we have electric matress heaters that make a clicking noise in the rad=
io when the controller is on. When the furnace comes on, it affects the box=
es, and--when I first started doign EVP recordings with white noise, if the=
 furnace happened to come on when I was recording a voice would report "it'=
s on fire!".

   What if that house has aluminum wire?

   Frank-S


  On T=
ue, May 26, 2009 at 5:15 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombieghostresea=
rch.com> wrote:





    Thanks! Would that account for the tapping noise?
=

      ----- Original Message ----- 
      From: Rj 
      To: EVP-ITC@yaho=
ogroups.com 
      Sent: Tuesday, May 26, 2009 4:07 PM
      Subject: Re: [=
EVP-ITC] Electrical Question


            Yes.  Also faulty wiring, which =
is even more dangerous.
            Also with flakey transformers or other =
power distribution in the area, or power lines.
            Perhaps you can=
 check with some neighbors, and see how their power is doing.


           =
 --- On Tue, 5/26/09, April Abercrombie <april@...=
> wrote:


              From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombieghostres=
earch.com>
              Subject: [EVP-ITC] Electrical Question
           =
   To: "EVP-ITC Group" <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
              Date: Tuesda=
y, May 26, 2009, 2:52 PM



              Hi All,

              Is there s=
omeone here that can answer and electrical question for me?

              =
During the case that I recorded those possible EVP's-there was a loud tappi=
ng noise that seemed to come from the 2nd bedroom. Upon checking my logs, e=
very time one of  these clicks were heard, there would be an EMF spike in t=
he livingroom. The 2nd bedroom is upstairs, the livingroom downstairs. The =
home owners have also reported that they have a touch lamp that comes on al=
l the time by itself and the lights in the Kitchen will dim occasionally.

=
              Now these taps are not consistent in timing, loudness or rhyt=
hm. Could this be the work of faulty breakers?

              Thanks!
     =
         April
